fields.body:
There was a time it seemed as though
My life was tossing to and fro
And I, left with nowhere to go,
Was subject to the sea.

But there, ahead, a beam of light
Peered through the darkness of the night
And granted to me clearer sight
That I might be set free.

I steered a course toward the land
To find a refuge on the sand
And maybe touch the gentle hand
That guided me along.

And when I reached the coast that night,
Upon a hill, the shining light
Was tended by a welcome sight . . .
My friends had led me home.

Adur Sea of Lights is a pilot Christmas event to be held in Lancing but aimed at the whole of the Adur District. It centres on the creation of lanterns and culminates in a procession/ performance that the whole community can participate in.

Its main aims are:

  • To bring an artistic and inspiring event to Lancing and Sompting, reaching out to sections of the community who would not otherwise be part of an artistic endeavour.
  • To inspire a sense of community and friendship within Adur.
  • To be totally inclusive and highly accessible.
  • To bring additional business into Lancing’s shopping street and Christmas market.
  • To boost the local economy and showcase local talent.
  • To become a reasonable sized annual event that would put Lancing on the local arts map.

The day will be split into two parts:

Part 1. Creation

Adur Sea Of Lights Partners will host morning workshops to make lanterns or other sea-based craft activities. It will be for all ages and abilities and will have a variety of activities. This also gives an opportunity for those who have not yet made a lantern for the evening procession to do so.

We consider that this should be either free or ask for a discretionary donation towards materials to allow a maximum of people to participate.

The workshops will finish around lunch-time, allowing people to either go home, or explore the Christmas market.

Part 2. Performance

We will meet at the Monks Recreation Ground at around 3pm dressed up and carrying our lanterns. There will be half an hour for people to assemble. Then the lantern procession, samba band and other creative people will head off for a colourful circuit of Lancing village, returning to Monks Recreation Ground for an orchestrated Grand Glow-show Finale.

Attendees will then be able to disperse into the Christmas market which has been extended to finish at 5pm.

If you would like to get involved, then please do join our forum here. We're a friendly bunch and we'd love to hear from you!

fields.body:
Our schools' team have had a successful first meeting where they discussed how primary schools can best be involved in the parade. They are looking forward to contacting all of the schools within the Adur area next term with exciting packs of information about the Sea of Lights.

The hope is to have schools making large creations to be carried in the parade. We will be holding workshops and visiting the schools to facilitate this. There will also be a trophy for the 'best' creation which will be judged independently from us.

fields.body:
Andrea attended a "Trade Secrets" workshop at the Lantern Company in Liverpool where she had a fantastic opportunity to learn all of othe tricks of the trade.

Getting there was touch and go considering the unexpected March snow that affected the whole counrty, but luckily Liverpool, although freezing, was not too badly affected. The lantern company hold amazing events across the year, most notibly their Halloween event. They have also been comissioned to make long living lanterns for Chichester zoo.

Andrea went to their celebration exhibtion which showed 10 years of amazing work. The exhibition and course were held at the magnificent St Georges Hall, Liverpool. There were giant skeletons, curious characters and enchanting animals that lit up the very depths of the world-famous St Georges Hall. 

It was really exciting to be at the opening of St George’s previously hidden basement, where the Escher-like optical illusion of the magnificent brick arches house the world’s very first air conditioning system.

She learnt lots of cool techniques from a team with a decade of lantern making experience. All of the magic, carnivals and visual story telling will soon be revealed!
